phases.name: Absorption Phase
phases.description: Building mental maps through repetition. Focus: listening + Anki + basic output.

phases.name: Volume Phase
phases.description: Massive input. Transition to native content. Build speaking confidence.

phases.name: Output Phase
phases.description: Active production. B2 exam prep. Make everything automatic.

A2.name: Anki: Review all due cards
A2.description: Don't skip. This is muscle memory building. Focus on A2 vocabulary.

A2.name: Anki: Add 5 new A2 cards from Clémence
A2.description: Pick 5 words/phrases from recent Clémence lessons. Include example sentences.

A2.name: Anki: Review + 5 new cards (A2 connectors)
A2.description: Donc, alors, puis, ensuite, enfin — linking words for storytelling.

B1.name: Anki: Review all due cards
B1.description: Focus on B1 subjunctive triggers and conditionals. Don't rush.

B1.name: Anki: Add 5 new B1 cards (subjunctive/conditional)
B1.description: Il faut que, bien que, pour que... Add verb conjugations + examples.

B1.name: Anki: Review + 10 new B1 vocabulary cards
B1.description: Advanced vocabulary from InnerFrench or Clémence B1 lessons.

B2.name: Anki: Review all due cards
B2.description: B2 vocab consolidation. Focus on formal register and discourse markers.

B2.name: Anki: Add 10 new B2 cards (advanced connectors)
B2.description: Cependant, néanmoins, par ailleurs, en outre — essay-level connectors.

B2.name: Anki: Review B2 idioms and expressions
B2.description: Focus on natural-sounding phrases and collocations.

A2.name: Simply French Podcast A2 episode
A2.description: Pick any A2 episode. Listen twice — first for gist, second for details.

A2.name: InnerFrench slow episode (beginner)
A2.description: Hugo speaks slowly. Just absorb — don't translate everything.

A2.name: Easy French street interviews (A2 level)
A2.description: Real conversations with French subtitles. Note 5 new words.

A2.name: Français Facile news segment
A2.description: News in simplified French. Current events at manageable speed.

B1.name: InnerFrench B1 episode (normal speed)
B1.description: Normal speed. Take notes on 5 new words + their context.

B1.name: Simply French Podcast B1 episode
B1.description: Intermediate level. Listen without subtitles first, then with.

B1.name: Easy French street interviews
B1.description: Real French, unscripted. Use French subtitles if needed.

B1.name: RFI news in slow French
B1.description: Current events at manageable speed. Great for real-world vocabulary.

B2.name: InnerFrench B2 episode (advanced topics)
B2.description: Complex topics. No English support. Take notes in French.

B2.name: France Culture podcast episode
B2.description: Native-speed, intellectual discussions. Push your limits.

B2.name: Le Monde news podcast
B2.description: Real news for French people. No simplification.

B2.name: Simply French B2 conversation
B2.description: Advanced discussions on current topics.

A2.name: Record yourself: describe your day (2 minutes)
A2.description: Talk out loud. Don't stop to think. Use present + passé composé.

A2.name: Shadow 10 sentences from last Clémence lesson
A2.description: Repeat out loud 10x each. Mimic pronunciation exactly.

A2.name: Shadow a Simply French A2 episode you already heard
A2.description: Full episode shadowing. Pause and repeat each sentence.

A2.name: Practice introducing yourself (3 different ways)
A2.description: Formal, informal, professional. Record all three.

B1.name: Prep 3 topics for imaginary conversation
B1.description: What would you talk about with a French friend? Write key vocab, then speak for 2min on each topic.

B1.name: Shadow InnerFrench episode you've already heard
B1.description: Full episode. Focus on intonation patterns.

B1.name: Record yourself: tell a story from your week
B1.description: 5 minutes. Use imparfait for description, passé composé for events.

B1.name: Practice giving your opinion on 3 topics
B1.description: Pick: télétravail, réseaux sociaux, écologie. 2min each. Use 'Je pense que..., à mon avis...'

B2.name: Record 5min opinion piece on a complex topic
B2.description: Pick: immigration, AI, climate change. Argue BOTH sides. Use formal connectors.

B2.name: Shadow native-speed podcast (InnerFrench B2)
B2.description: Entire episode. Focus on natural rhythm and liaison.

B2.name: DELF B2 oral exam practice (monologue)
B2.description: Pick a topic, prepare 3min, speak for 5min without notes.

B2.name: Debate with yourself: take opposing positions
B2.description: Record 3min for each side of a controversial topic.

A2.name: Read short RFI article (A2 level)
A2.description: Journal en français facile. Read twice, note 5 unknown words.

A2.name: Read Clémence dialogue from A2 lessons
A2.description: Pick any dialogue. Read out loud, then write a summary.

A2.name: Read short story from Clémence A2 Stories
A2.description: Absorb naturally. Don't look up every word.

B1.name: Read Le Monde article (simplified version)
B1.description: Pick a topic you care about. Take notes on main ideas.

B1.name: Read InnerFrench transcript
B1.description: Pick an episode you've already listened to. Read for deeper understanding.

B1.name: Read French news site (20 Minutes, HugoDécrypte)
B1.description: Skim headlines, read 2 full articles on topics you like.

B2.name: Read full Le Monde or Libération article
B2.description: No simplification. Opinion pieces are great for B2 vocab.

B2.name: Read French literature excerpt (Clémence B2 stories)
B2.description: Literary French. Take your time. Analyze sentence structure.

B2.name: Read academic/professional French article
B2.description: Wikipedia français, academic blogs. Formal register practice.

A2.name: Write 5 sentences using today's grammar point
A2.description: From Clémence lesson. Make them personal and relevant to you.

A2.name: Write a short message to an imaginary French friend
A2.description: 100 words. Tell them about your day or plans.

A2.name: Describe your home in French (100 words)
A2.description: Use prepositions of location. Be specific.

B1.name: Write 100-word journal entry
B1.description: Mix of tenses. Describe something that happened + your feelings about it.

B1.name: Write a short opinion piece (150 words)
B1.description: Pick a topic. Introduction, 2 arguments, conclusion. Use connectors.

B1.name: Write a formal email (150 words)
B1.description: Request information, complain about something, or apply for something.

B2.name: Write 200-word opinion essay
B2.description: Formal register. Use discourse markers: toutefois, néanmoins, en outre.

B2.name: DELF B2 writing practice: essay
B2.description: Take a past DELF B2 writing prompt. 250 words. Timed.

B2.name: Write a detailed response to a debate topic
B2.description: Present both sides, then your position. 300 words.

A2.name: Clémence A2 lesson + detailed notes
A2.description: Watch, pause frequently, write down 5 key points + 3 example sentences.

A2.name: Clémence A2 dialogue practice
A2.description: Pick a dialogue. Listen 3x, then write your own similar dialogue.

A2.name: Review past Clémence A2 lesson + do all quizzes
A2.description: Spaced repetition. Revisit a lesson from 1-2 weeks ago.

B1.name: Clémence B1 lesson + practice exercises
B1.description: Watch lesson, take notes, then create your own 5 practice sentences.

B1.name: Clémence B1 complex grammar deep dive
B1.description: Subjunctive, conditional, plus-que-parfait. Watch + create 10 examples.

B1.name: Clémence listening comprehension (B1)
B1.description: Do a B1 listening exercise. Check answers, review mistakes.

B2.name: Clémence B2 lesson + advanced application
B2.description: Watch lesson, then write a 200-word paragraph using the grammar point.

B2.name: Clémence B2 discourse markers lesson
B2.description: Focus on essay-level connectors. Write a formal paragraph using 10+ markers.

B2.name: Clémence DELF B2 prep module
B2.description: Exam-specific strategies and practice.
